  • Field Details

    • drawPile

      public static final Deck drawPile
      Represents the draw pile of the game, which serves as the primary deck of cards used during gameplay. Players draw cards from this pile during their turns or as part of game actions.

      The draw pile is initialized with a shuffled deck that does not include duplicates or other special configurations unless explicitly defined in game setup.

      The draw pile is a shared resource for all players and plays a critical role in maintaining the flow of the game.

    • discardPile

      public static final Deck discardPile
      Represents the discard pile in the card game.

      This static field holds the deck of cards designated as the discard pile. The discard pile is initialized with an empty state, allowing cards to be added during gameplay as players play their turns.

      The discard pile serves as the central location for cards discarded by players, with the topmost card on this pile determining certain game rules or moves.

    • players

      public static Player[] players
      An array representing all the players in the game.

      This array holds instances of the `Player` class, which represent both human and computer-controlled players involved in the game. The first player in the array is typically the human player, and later entries represent computer-controlled players (bots).

      The number of elements in this array is determined during game initialization and includes one human player alongside a configurable number of bots. The order of players in the array reflects the turn order during gameplay.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()

  • Method Details

    • initGame

      public static void initGame(int numBots, String playerUsername)
      Initializes the game by setting up the draw pile, discard pile, and players. The draw pile is reset, a starting card is placed on the discard pile, and the players are created. At least one human player is assumed, with additional computer-controlled players based on the specified number of bots.
      Parameters:
      numBots - the number of computer-controlled players to include in the game

    • getFlowDirection

      public static int getFlowDirection()
      Retrieves the current flow direction of the game. The flow direction determines the order in which players take turns. A positive value (e.g., 1) indicates clockwise flow, while a negative value (e.g., -1) denotes counterclockwise flow.
      Returns:
      the current flow direction as an integer, where 1 represents clockwise, and -1 represents counterclockwise.

    • flipFlowDirection

      public static void flipFlowDirection()
      Reverses the current flow direction of the game. The flow direction determines the order in which players take turns. A value of 1 represents clockwise flow, while a value of -1 represents counterclockwise flow. This method toggles the flow direction between these two states.

    • addCardsToNextPlayer

      public static void addCardsToNextPlayer(boolean fourCards)
      Adds a specified number of cards to the next player's hand from the draw pile. The number of cards added depends on the given boolean parameter. If fourCards is true, four cards will be added; otherwise, two cards will be added.
      Parameters:
      fourCards - a boolean value indicating whether to add four cards (true) or two cards (false)

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public static int getCurrentPlayer()
      Retrieves the index of the current player whose turn it is in the game.
      Returns:
      the index of the current player as an integer.

    • advancePlayer

      public static void advancePlayer()
      Advances turn to the next player in the game.

      This method updates the `currentPlayer` field to reflect the next player's turn based on the current flow direction and player order. The next player is calculated using the private `getNextPlayer` method, which ensures the appropriate player index is determined, wrapping around if necessary.

    • skipPlayer

      public static void skipPlayer()
      Skips the current player's turn in the game.

      This method advances the player pointer by two positions, effectively skipping the next player. It adjusts the `currentPlayer` index based on the total number of players and the game's flow direction to ensure proper wrapping within bounds. The resulting player index is calculated using modular arithmetic to guarantee it remains within the range of valid player indices.

    • isPlayerTurn

      public static boolean isPlayerTurn()
      Determines whether it is currently the human player's turn. The first player (index 0) is assumed to be the human player.
      Returns:
      true if it is the human player's turn; false otherwise.

    • endGame

      public static void endGame()

    • getWinningPlayer

      public static int getWinningPlayer()

    • isGameOver

      public static boolean isGameOver()
      Determines whether the game is currently over.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over; false otherwise.

    • printBotSummary

      public static void printBotSummary()
      Prints a summary of all bot players' game statuses.

      This method iterates through all players in the game starting from the second player, since the first player is assumed to be the human player. For each bot player, the following details are included in the summary: - The bot's username - The most recent card the bot has played - The total number of cards remaining in the bot's hand

      The information is formatted, separated by dividing lines, and displayed using a utility method for rendering a text-based user interface box.
